page.title: 02BOWDEN VILLAGE
page.content: Bowden is a small village with a population of approx. 200.There are marginally more old people than young.The village is a designated conservation area with the majority of the houses grouped around the village green. There are very few facilities.There is a small general store/post office selling most necessities except bread and meat,although twice a week there are butchers and bakers vans.The mobile library calls once a week with a comprehensive selection of books. As there is no train service and the bus service is local and not very frequent,it is necessary for most families to provide their own transport particularly if they wish to travel to the larger centres of population.
